Job Posting:171676 - Position: F25 IT Co-op Opportunities - Network Administration, Software Development, IT Support & Help Desk 171676B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 08/13/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 07/30/2025 10:49 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Province / State Country Decor Cabinet Company #200 Route 100, Morden MB Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 IT Co-op Opportunities - Network Administration, Software Development, IT Support & Help Desk 171676B Co-op Position Morden, MB Canada 4 months In-Person CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List IT Co-op Opportunities - Network Administration, Software Development, IT Support & Help Desk Location: Morden, MB (On-Site) | Full-Time, Paid Co-op Are you a student passionate about technology and eager to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and innovative IT environment? Join our team for an exciting co-op term where you'll contribute to real projects, collaborate with experienced professionals, and build the skills that will shape your future career. We're currently offering co-op opportunities in the following areas: ? Network Administration Gain experience in maintaining, securing, and optimizing enterprise networks. You'll assist with configuring hardware, monitoring system performance, and troubleshooting connectivity issues to ensure seamless operations. ? Software Development Work alongside our developers on a variety of software solutions. You'll contribute to coding, testing, debugging, and enhancing internal tools or customer-facing applications using modern development practices. ? IT Support & Help Desk Be the first point of contact for technical issues across the organization. Learn to diagnose and resolve hardware and software problems, support onboarding/offboarding processes, and help ensure a positive user experience. What You'll Do Support day-to-day operations in your assigned area • • Participate in team meetings, knowledge sharing, and documentation • Work on projects that contribute to real business outcomes • Learn and grow with guidance from experienced mentors Why Join Us? Gain meaningful, real-world experience in a supportive and collaborative environment • • Contribute to projects that make a difference • Develop technical and professional skills that will serve you throughout your career A culture that values innovation and continuous improvement • Job Requirements What We're Looking For Currently enrolled in a Computer Science, Information Technology, Networking, or related program • • Strong communication and problem-solving skills • A team player with a willingness to learn Experience with relevant tools or systems (e.g., Windows, Linux, Office 365, scripting, or networking protocols) is an asset • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Coop Student | Decor Cabinets Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
